The Temporary Assistance for Needy Families Block Grant Program is extended through March 31, 2004 under Title I of the Family Assistance Provisions. Activities authorized by part A of title IV of the Social Security Act, and by sections 510, 1108(b), and 1925 of such Act, shall continue through March 31, 2004, in the manner authorized for fiscal year 2002. Grants and payments may be made for carrying out such activities during the first two quarters of fiscal year 2004 at the level provided for the first two quarters of fiscal year 2002. In fiscal year 2002, there are amendments made to the Social Security Act regarding grants and payments for certain states. The changes include adjusting dates from 2003 to March 31, 2004, and from 2001 to fiscal year 2001. Additionally, the contingency fund deadline is extended from 2003 to 2004. The Social Security Act amendments include changing dates from 2003 to 2004 and extending the contingency fund deadline to 2004 or 2005. Extension of the national random sample study of child welfare and child welfare waiver authority is extended through March 31, 2004, with necessary funds appropriated for activities authorized by the Social Security Act. Grants and payments can be made for these activities in the first two quarters of fiscal year 2004 at the same level as in fiscal year 2002. TITLE II--TAX PROVISIONS

SEC. 201. Amends section 6103(l)(13) of the Internal Revenue Code to extend disclosure of return information for student loan repayment until December 31, 2004.
